data.text:
Exorcist ‚Äì Linda Blair & Pazuzu painted kits

Posts

3Demonic

Participant

Hi all,

First time poster, long time Exorcist fan here.

I paint model kits as a hobby and the Exorcist is one subject matter that‚Äôs

near and dear to me.

Here are a few shots of 2 recent kits I painted, which are lifesize scale‚Ä¶Hope

you enjoy them!

You can visit [url=‚Äùhttp://www.3demonic.com‚Äù%5D for more exorcist work and others

Linda Blair bust:

Pazuzu wall plaque:

fatherbowdern

Participant

3Demonic,

I love this work!

Being inquisitive, are you and Pete Murphy the same person?

An original mention of Pete‚Äôs work came from this posting about the Captain Howdy/Pazuzu wall plaque. This was on sale on eBay a few weeks ago, and I actually wrote to the artist; unfortunately I never heard back:

On eBay, crazyclayer6o8u, from Raleigh, North Carolina, USA had this on sale:

http://captainhowdy.com/forum/the-exorcist-original/very-cool-captain-howdy-bust/

The Pazuzu piece says it‚Äôs copyrighted √Ç¬© 2009 Peter Gabriel Murphy @ http://www.petemurph.com/

When I click on 3Demonic, the Linda Blair bust indicates it‚Äôs copyrighted √Ç¬© 2010 Killer Kits (Copyright √Ç¬© 2000/2005 3Demonic).

The talent is amazing, so I am making an assumption that Pete‚Äôs work and Killer Kits and 3Demonic are all the same, correct?

Father Bowdern

3Demonic

Participant

Hi and thanks for the feedback!

No, I‚Äôm not Peter Murphy. Peter sculpted and produces the Pazuzu kit and Killer Kits (UK) produced the Linda Blair kitm both of which came as blank resin copies‚Ä¶I painted both of them.

GhettoExorcist

Participant

Nothing short of amazing!!! I would definitely like to own one if I wasn‚Äôt sure that I‚Äôd pee myself every time I enter a room with one of those busts looking at me with those lifelike grimacing faces.

fatherbowdern

Participant

3Demonic,

Emphasizing Ghetto‚Äôs comment ‚Ä¶ you rock as an artist. Are those glass eyes? Fill us in on how you acheive these great works of art ‚Ä¶ I think you‚Äôll find the fans on here are quite dedicated to the behind-the-scenes approaches.

Thanks for sharing these!

Father Bowdern

3Demonic

Participant

Thanks Ghetto & Father Bowdern (cool nick BTW)‚Ä¶

The eyes are not glass‚Ä¶I prefer to paint all my eyes. I use an airbrush fr painting kits, each subject matter requires a different technique but one thing I always aim for is realism.

Duplicating skin, even possessed ones, is always a challenge and requires painting several thin/translucent layers to build depth and replicate how skin reflects light and behaves over veins and muscle tissue.

As far as our Linda is concerned, trying to replicate Dick Smith‚Äôs wizardry was not easy! Dick Smith and Rick Baker are the true masters of modern horror FX.

Jagged

Participant

That Regan bust is just fantastic. Is that this kit with some alterations?

http://daveskillerkits.tripod.com/exbust.html

If so your skills are pretty remarkable and I‚Äôm going to have to grab myself one and remodel it in a similar vein.

3Demonic

Participant

Thanks Jagged‚Ä¶Yep, that‚Äôs the one!

fatherbowdern

Participant

3Demonic,

Did you also paint the other masks on 3Demonic.com?

Father Bowdern

etrigan69

Participant

My god man. Those are both incredible. The eyes are awesome. I thought you used glass eyes also.

I‚Äôve been painting figure model kits for 20 years + and those are seriously some of the nicest paint ups I‚Äôve ever seen.

How did you do the hair? Is it punched or a wig? That can‚Äôt be the hair that came with the kit!

3Demonic

Participant

Father Bowdern said:

Did you also paint the other masks on 3Demonic.com?

Yes, that‚Äôs right.

Etrigan, thanks very much‚Ä¶great to see a fellow painter here üôÇ

The hair is a wig, which I sourced specifically for the kit. I trimmed and styled until I got the right look. The bust came with a wig, but it was useless.

Participant

3Demonic ‚Ä¶ I think you have great abilities! I hope you are applying them in a field of work that is both creative and exciting. üôÇ
